wiki.content:
This version of Silent Night was recorded by Drongomala when living in Kerala for 2 years recording with Carnatic musicians. It was recorded against the backdrop of 9/11.
 
 Recently in Bombay there were terror attacks and there still continues to be demonisation of whole ethnic groups on all sides across the world. This track, from the album 100 Fields, was made with 2 Hindus, 2 Christians, 2 Muslims, 1 agnostic, 1 spiritualist and a Drongomala .
 
  A notably wonderful Veena part played by Biju is a must listen on this track. Musicians are:
 
     * Drongomala : vocals, acoustic guitar and arrangements.
     * Balu - mridangham
     * A.R. Biju : veena
     * Jon Thorne : double bass
     * Ian Holmes-Lewis : percussion
     * Sanjay/Merlin/Lenoy/Sandra/Ramesh/Sujith - choir
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: This version of Silent Night was recorded by Drongomala when living in Kerala for 2 years recording with Carnatic musicians. It was recorded against the backdrop of 9/11.  Recently in Bombay there were terror attacks and there still continues to be demonisation of whole ethnic groups on all sides across the world. This track, from the album 100 Fields, was made with 2 Hindus, 2 Christians, 2 Muslims, 1 agnostic, 1 spiritualist and a Drongomala .
